intro: Claytonia perfoliata var. utahensis, commonly known as Utah springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of oval, fleshy leaves and stems that bear clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. It blooms in early spring, making it one of the first wildflowers to appear after winter. The species is noted for its ability to tolerate cold temperatures and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
